etymology.description: 竹 (bamboo) + 果 (fruit) = a specific type of fruit
etymology.interpretation: 竹果 is a rare term that might refer to a type of fruit associated with or resembling bamboo in some manner. It is not common in modern language and may appear in specialized or historical texts.

examples.chinese: 在古时的植物学书中，有提到一种称为竹果(竹果)的特殊果实。
examples.pinyin: Zài gǔ shí de zhíwùxué shū zhōng, yǒu tí dào yī zhǒng chēng wèi zhúguǒ de tèshū guǒshí.
examples.english: In ancient botanical texts, there is mention of a special fruit called 竹果.

examples.chinese: 竹果的样子在旧时的绘画中偶尔可以见到(竹果的樣子在舊時的繪畫中偶爾可以見到)。
examples.pinyin: Zhúguǒ de yàngzi zài jiù shí de huìhuà zhōng ǒu'ěr kěyǐ jiàndào.
examples.english: The appearance of 竹果 can occasionally be seen in old paintings.
